Package org.jtrim2.access

Contains classes and interfaces for managing concurrent access to limited resources.

See: Description

  • Interface Summary 
    Interface Description
    AccessChangeListener<IDType,RightType>
    The listener interface for receiving notification of acquiring and releasing access tokens.
    AccessManager<IDType,RightType>
    Manages read and write access to resources.
    AccessToken<IDType>
    Allows execution of tasks while having read or write (exclusive) access to some resources.
  • Class Summary 
    Class Description
    AbstractAccessToken<IDType>
    A convenient base class for AccessToken implementations.
    AccessManagers
    A utility class containing static convenience methods for AccessManagers.
    AccessProperties
    Defines static utility methods to track the availability of rights of an AccessManager as a PropertySource (with Boolean value).
    AccessRequest<IDType,RightType>
    Defines the access request passed to an AccessManager.
    AccessResult<IDType>
    Defines the result of an AccessToken request from an AccessManager.
    AccessTokens
    A utility class containing static convenience methods for AccessTokens.
    DelegatedAccessToken<IDType>
    An AccessToken implementation which delegates all of its methods to another AccessToken specified at construction time.
    HierarchicalAccessManager<IDType>
    An implementation of AccessManager which can manage hierarchical rights.
    HierarchicalRight
    Defines hierarchically structured rights defined by list of right objects.
    ScheduledAccessToken<IDType>
    Defines an AccessToken that will execute submitted tasks only after a specified set of AccessTokens terminate.

Package org.jtrim2.access Description

Contains classes and interfaces for managing concurrent access to limited resources. This package is not intended to be used for security and it was designed only for cooperating tasks to share resources safely. The resources can be many things like TCP connections or Swing components but this package was mainly designed for GUIs to detect that a task conflict with already running tasks. Note however that this package only contains general interfaces and instances not directly related to GUIs.

Access managers

Access managers are responsible for managing rights, so that no conflicting rights are available to users concurrently. The base interface for access managers is: AccessManager. See its description for further details.

Access tokens

Access tokens represent rights to a given resource. It is possible to create TaskExecutor instances which execute tasks only if their access token has not been released (i.e.: still available to the client code). These tokens are usually created by access managers and will only be useful until they are released. After an access token was released owners no longer hold the rights represented by this access token unless they acquire another such token. The base interface for access tokens is: AccessToken. See its description for further details.

Tracking the availability of rights

You might want to track if a right can be acquired from an AccessManager or not. For example, you might use this information to disable or enable a GUI component. To support this, you should use boolean properties. Boolean properties can be created for tracking the availability of rights using the factory methods in AccessProperties.
See Also:
AccessManager, AccessProperties, AccessToken, HierarchicalAccessManager
